Sentence: Bilbo is quite content at Bag End, near the bustling hobbit village of Hobbiton, but one day his (Bilbo) comfort is shattered by the arrival of the old wizard Gandalf, who persuades Bilbo to set out on an adventure with a group of thirteen militant dwarves
(Bilbo)', "The dwarves are very skeptical about Gandalf's choice for a burglar, and Bilbo is terrified to leave his (Bilbo) comfortable life to seek adventure
But Gandalf assures both Bilbo and the dwarves that there is more to the little hobbit than meets the eye
Gandalf and the dwarf lord Thorin take magic swords, and Bilbo takes a small sword of his (Bilbo) own
Gandalf leads the dwarves to a passage out of the mountain, but they accidentally leave behind Bilbo
He (Bilbo) finds a tunnel leading up out of the mountain and discovers that the dwarves and Gandalf have already escaped
When Thorin learns what Bilbo has done, he (Bilbo) is livid, but Gandalf suddenly reappears and saves Bilbo from the dwarf lord's wrath
After the battle, Bilbo and Gandalf return to Hobbiton, where Bilbo continues to live
